We now know the President not only downplayed the information the Administration knew, but lied to every American to better himself.

We have seen how access to healthcare can be a matter of life & death. That’s why we must continue to protect and improve upon programs like Medicare and Medicaid. Anything less than that is a let down to the millions of hardworking men and women whose lives depend upon them.

Before Medicare and Medicaid, the poor, the elderly, and the disabled in America were forced to fend for themselves. To be old, poor and sick was to suffer and to die prematurely. 

Today, we are seeing that with COVID. 

It’s time to expand healthcare and pass Medicare for All.

Today Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar will be on Capitol Hill. There’s questions he must answer.

Amid a public health crisis, why does the Admin want to cut CDC funding?

With people struggling to access healthcare, why is the Admin cutting Medicaid?

Before the Affordable Care Act became law, 1.2 million Michiganders didn’t have health insurance. That number is now cut in half. We have the responsibility as a nation to work until every person has access to quality healthcare.

Weeks after the Trump budget proposed massive cuts to the CDC, they now ask for coronavirus response funding. The request is overdue & the amount requested is too low. We need coordinated efforts with real funding to be ready to properly respond to a potential outbreak in the US.

A half trillion cut to Medicare. A $900 billion cut to Medicaid.

At a time when hardworking men and women are struggling with healthcare access, the Trump Administration proposed massive cuts. We must ensure every American when sick can visit a doctor.
